title: Salahmu
author: Salahmu
content: I'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. I don't really no what is wrong with this country almost all the sector are corrupt, no more human rights, police are doing the work of road safety, people are more afraid of police than any other thing on the road because they will always find a fault to extot from you, I don't really no why is like that. The government does not even care how the less privilege are managing to survive, well one thing I love about most Nigerians is that regardless of how difficult it is to survive in this country people always device means to survive. Please let's share knowledge because I believe one of us in any way has been harase by a police officer, and also what do u really think about the fuel issue? Would the price come down or increase the more?

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. Omo. This one done become old news nah, we dey fine fresh update, abi is this the first time you dey buy fuel for #500? Because me I don buy fuel for #700 and even #1k before during fuel scarcity for Buhari regime, so this one no be new something, because one thing I like about Nigerians, we are good at adapting to change, because for this fuel matter, me originally, I don adapt to am, because what's the need of complaining when I already know within myself say that talk no go fit boil water. QuoteI don't really no what is wrong with this country almost all the sector are corrupt, no more human rights, police are doing the work of road safety, people are more afraid of police than any other thing on the road because they will always find a fault to extot from you, I don't really no why is like that. No be today this one start, na so eh don be since for we contri, the corruption dey everywhere for we society, both in schools, politics and even the church. Na only God fit help us.QuoteWould the price come down or increase the more? This one na only the NNPC or the minister of petroleum fit answer this very question, because eh get one old news I been hear some days ago if I'm not mistaken about NNPC giving only Dangote license to import & export petroleum products into we contri, (such as fuel, diesel, kerosene & e.t.c) of which we all know say him na business man, and the main aim of every business man go be to make profit, which is likely to affect fuel price upward immediately that commerce.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. Nigeria is lawless state. The first thing he the president would have done after the announcement of the fuel subsidy was the regulation of the fuel price but he allowed everyone to sell the price they want and that means he is also afraid of the fuel marketers. Upon all these crecata crecata the president dey do I never see anything from im. If anyone or a leader meant to work well for the citizens for the country, the number one thing to do is the policy to regulate all aspect of the country then things on their own would began to work well. And not to touch the politicians. The policies you make will affect every bad leader in the country.Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI don't really no what is wrong with this country almost all the sector are corrupt, no more human rights, police are doing the work of road safety, people are more afraid of police than any other thing on the road because they will always find a fault to extot from you, I don't really no why is like that. You dey tok of that one, no tok am sef. This one na misplacement of meritocracy. Nigerian police has forgotten their office since 1968. Fuel price might come down if the president work on it. The click on marketers are more powerful than the president im sef. But things will be ok. Now has dey come down now.

comments.author: RockBell
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. I don't really no what is wrong with this country almost all the sector are corrupt, no more human rights, police are doing the work of road safety, people are more afraid of police than any other thing on the road because they will always find a fault to extot from you, I don't really no why is like that. The government does not even care how the less privilege are managing to survive, well one thing I love about most Nigerians is that regardless of how difficult it is to survive in this country people always device means to survive. Please let's share knowledge because I believe one of us in any way has been harase by a police officer, and also what do u really think about the fuel issue? Would the price come down or increase the more? The problem now is that the price of fuel always has an impact on everything. One thing I noticed, especially in this country, is that many people are opportunist and constantly seek out ways to exploit people. When the president mentioned it, the price had already started to shoot up, to the point where some filling stations were selling for 600 naira. The government always assumes that people will adjust, and that is what is currently happening. I notice that many people no longer drive their cars anymore instead, they take public transportation, even to get to work. Therefore, I don't believe that the price will decrease. Lets hope for implementations that will make people relax and not feel the impact.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. Please let's share knowledge because I believe one of us in any way has been harase by a police officer, and also what do u really think about the fuel issue? Would the price come down or increase the more? Wetin you wan discuss na Police harassment abi fuel subsidy, I hope you understand wetin removal of fuel subsidy be? Before the country been get control which is the fuel subsidy but now dem dun commot am so how you want dem to get control again. Make i make you understand how this thing dey work. Before you (citizens of Nigeria) dey always by sweet (fuel) from your street (filling station) for 10 naira but you no know say your uncle (Nigeria government) been dun already dey pay half payment (subsidy) for all the shops wey dey sell sweet to you but now him dun stop to dey pay the subsidy for you to help control price. As him dun comot the subsidy so the shops dun rush dey sell 50 Naira per sweet but this price no go last for ever, as more people are been given licence to dey operate the shops (refinery and filling station) price go dey come down small small. Now the price control dey in the hands of the market and not the government anymore. To bring down the price of fuels, things like giving local refinery license to operate and repair the refinery putting it in a good shape to operate need to be done because without them they just empowered only Dangote to dominate the oil industry.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. Omo guy, where you comot from today come dey drop dis update wey don full everywhere? Ahbi your time zone dey behind the ones wey we dey use for our country? Dis matter don pass and if you wan know more about why government increase the price of fuel or the reason fuel subsidy removal, you fit go through dis  thread wey one of our naija guys drop for here. QuoteThe government does not even care how the less privilege are managing to survive, well one thing I love about most Nigerians is that regardless of how difficult it is to survive in this country people always device means to survive. Dis one na so e be and e be like na trademark for us for Naija here. Dis wan na sign say God still dey with us and dey always see us through every hardship wey our leaders wan impose against us. Las las, we go all survive and make am for dis our dear country.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. If it is about the price of fuel to reduce, forget am, because em no the happen since the FG government don kukuma commot their hand for fuel subsidy. So any price wey we as Nigerians see from filling stations, na wetin we go buy fuel at, since na individuals and private bodies go d refine fuel for us for abroad, come give us as a country. We Nigerians should continue to be expecting and be seeing fuel increase from time to time because as I take the see am fuel go fit reach 700naira soon. You know as em be so when it does, transportation and cost of living go increase alsoQuote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI don't really no what is wrong with this country almost all the sector are corrupt, no more human rights, police are doing the work of road safety, people are more afraid of police than any other thing on the road because they will always find a fault to extot from you, I don't really no why is like that. If na for this our country em don jaga-jaga beyond repair. Where do we start to fix am? Corruption don full every sector. Every sector d find whom them go chop local for them to survive the hardship wey d for the country. Even the police people don leave their suppose work, the follow Agbero around the task motorists. It is so pitiful sae police people don degrade themselves to instruments wey every given sector go remote to their bindings. Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMThe government does not even care how the less privilege are managing to survive Wetin you d expect from a government wey their family no dey for this our country? Their assets and medical care dey elsewhere. They are unconcerned or unresponsive to what the masses are going through. They and their family have everything they need to lead comfortable lives so them no d bother for the masses matter. It is well sha cos we go always survive am no matter how bad it is for us in the country.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Simce the removal of subsidy, every commercial retails now sells at their own offer price independently, this makes the scarcity been dealt with and the issue associated now is onnthe affordability, will things continue to go like this whereby inflation continue to rise to an extent of no limit or we should expect more coming from the current experience to solve the issues on ground about inflation and pump price for fuel.

comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: The politicians are insensitive to the feeling of the people, poverty dey everywhere but dem no want know about that one but instead dem go try carry more money enter house. Now we dey hear say dem want share the subsidy money wey comot whether na rumour we never know, inside every rumour small truth go dey inside. Them no even talk about refinery but na how to share money dem get interest even NLC self no dey help matter.

comments.author: omgitsmehehe
comments.body: To me e get inside fight wey dey happen among and between politicians that is affecting the citizens, politicians know what they are doing for their own respective benefits, the price of fuel will continue to dey increase until the poor can no longer breath, believe me. It's not new things to me again that the country is acting this way, It had been like this from when I was small, wetin vex me again na the price of pure water wey take style increase him own matter, imagine a bag of pure water jump from 250 naira to 400 naira, e no make sense at all, and all this price increase now na fuel dey cause am, Another matter na police harassment, I've been harassed so many times cos I'm looking good as a young boy, where did I get the money to buy this big powerbank in your hand, look at the kind of phone you are using, which work wey you dey do, who be your papa, call am say we don arrest you, you be yahoo boy. You go tell us where you get the money from to buy all this things, play play 20k comot from my hand o,, these two issue of fuel increase and police harassment are one of the reasons people leave the country to settle another African side, it's annoying.

comments.author: Timmzzy
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. I don't really no what is wrong with this country almost all the sector are corrupt, no more human rights, police are doing the work of road safety, people are more afraid of police than any other thing on the road because they will always find a fault to extot from you, I don't really no why is like that. The government does not even care how the less privilege are managing to survive, well one thing I love about most Nigerians is that regardless of how difficult it is to survive in this country people always device means to survive. Please let's share knowledge because I believe one of us in any way has been harase by a police officer, and also what do u really think about the fuel issue? Would the price come down or increase the more? On this one bro to be honest with you ehh POLICE OFFICER never harassed me for road before like na my 6 to 7 years i don apply road, i dont know if na grace tho but the the truth i dey talk, one thing ehh wey dey make police go this far to wan intimidate you one way to another na say the way you appear and the way you approach them when them dey check point. And as for the fuel side ehhh this one dey choke me, and NO idea when price go drop down, we all are still having our fingers cross.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Gozie51 on June 22, 2023, 04:41:40 PMThe politicians are insensitive to the feeling of the people, poverty dey everywhere but dem no want know about that one but instead dem go try carry more money enter house. Now we dey hear say dem want share the subsidy money wey comot whether na rumour we never know, inside every rumour small truth go dey inside. Them no even talk about refinery but na how to share money dem get interest even NLC self no dey help matter.Na better statement you just talk my brother man, because truly what I expected after the removal of this fuel subsidy matter na for Federal government to start to talk about reviving our old abandoned refineries back to start functioning again, so that we could no more keep buying fuel anymore. Because of what benefits will it be if the money is distributed,  of which I'm sure how the Covid-19 palliative ended up in the warehouses of top politicians, which I'm sure that's likewise how this money go be if shared. Because instead of sharing, they should use the money to create companies that will employ the youth.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PMI'm actually disappointed that a whole country like Nigeria doesn't have a price control, imagine our Baba presido just announced suspension of fuel subsidy and the next day all the fuel station done high there prices, I wonder how long is going to take for it to come back to it normal state. Imagine were you normally pay a certain amount and now because of the fuel price you have to pay x times two, to even make the matter worst, some fuel station are not selling for now based on the fact that they had information that fuel will increase more soon so they prefer to  reserve and sell high. Would the price come down or increase the more? Dis your yarning about the fuel subsidy mata no correct at all because e no be like say the government just wake up one morning come increase fuel price, rather de provision for fuel subsidy wey dey for national budget all dis years dem don comot am. Dem say by this method no body go dey control de price of fuel, rather na market factors go determine wetin de price go be. Dem also talk say initially we go experience suffering which na wetin we dey see so like the increment in transport fare and de high cost of commodities, but on de long run dem say de price go drop and things go better.

comments.author: Merit.s
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoHeadlineNews on June 23, 2023, 05:09:46 AMQuote from: Gozie51 on June 22, 2023, 04:41:40 PMThe politicians are insensitive to the feeling of the people, poverty dey everywhere but dem no want know about that one but instead dem go try carry more money enter house. Now we dey hear say dem want share the subsidy money wey comot whether na rumour we never know, inside every rumour small truth go dey inside. Them no even talk about refinery but na how to share money dem get interest even NLC self no dey help matter.Na better statement you just talk my brother man, because truly what I expected after the removal of this fuel subsidy matter na for Federal government to start to talk about reviving our old abandoned refineries back to start functioning again, so that we could no more keep buying fuel anymore. Because of what benefits will it be if the money is distributed,  of which I'm sure how the Covid-19 palliative ended up in the warehouses of top politicians, which I'm sure that's likewise how this money go be if shared. Because instead of sharing, they should use the money to create companies that will employ the youth.I no know why every action wey any leader take for Nigeria,na base on wetin go male them share money within themselves. Imagine the high rate of poverty for the country,our new president come enter finish. The first thing na to stop fuel subsidy in order for them to share subsidy money instead of them to focus on tackling the issue of the removal of the fuel subsidy. Na money them won share,forgetting say this action go inflate more hardship on the citizen and worry the country economy. Sometimes,I dey wonder whether all these leaders no suffer when them small and no decide to help people wey dey suffer for their agenda. Na only God fit help our country. Why e be say any new government wet enter na fuel subsidy he dey use worry the masses.

comments.author: Promocodeudo
comments.body: First of all was their anything like subsidy, the answer for me is NO.This subsidy of a thing is pure scam, the former leadership said that they were subsidizing premium motor spirit (PMS). But thats not true, this money always goes to some sychofants that loot this money and share it among themselves. But the scam is that, this people goes to the international market and buy this commodity at a normal price and in return charge the government very higher using transportation, high cost and high dollar rate as an excuse, They do all this with the help of the bad eggs in the system that convice the government that such scam called subsidy is real and they get paid at the end of the day for this unrealistic reasons, For them to get away freely they tag it a name called subsidy. That's why the NNPC limited chairman increased the price of the premium motor spirit (PMS) immediately after the inaugural speech of the president in other to cover up this scam called subsidy. The president ought to have arrested the NNPC limited chairman immediately after such chaotic pronouncement made by him and get him probed after probing if found wanting then he should be jailed for imporverishing Nigerians and financial crimes, It is only in Nigeria that a limited liability company has the power to make such pronouncement when the president said from 01/07/2023 Government will no longer accommodate such scam in Nigerian budget, But I believe with the look of things this government will do well, let's give them benefit of doubt and watch as event unfold as weeks run down the clock, I know it is really telling on us Nigerians but the needful has to be done, we cant continue to stand and watch some elements on disguise sharing our countries wealth when somany people are swimming in abject poverty it is unacceptable.

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: Quote from: Merit.s on June 23, 2023, 04:31:43 PMQuote from: CryptoHeadlineNews on June 23, 2023, 05:09:46 AMQuote from: Gozie51 on June 22, 2023, 04:41:40 PMThe politicians are insensitive to the feeling of the people, poverty dey everywhere but dem no want know about that one but instead dem go try carry more money enter house. Now we dey hear say dem want share the subsidy money wey comot whether na rumour we never know, inside every rumour small truth go dey inside. Them no even talk about refinery but na how to share money dem get interest even NLC self no dey help matter.Na better statement you just talk my brother man, because truly what I expected after the removal of this fuel subsidy matter na for Federal government to start to talk about reviving our old abandoned refineries back to start functioning again, so that we could no more keep buying fuel anymore. Because of what benefits will it be if the money is distributed,  of which I'm sure how the Covid-19 palliative ended up in the warehouses of top politicians, which I'm sure that's likewise how this money go be if shared. Because instead of sharing, they should use the money to create companies that will employ the youth.I no know why every action wey any leader take for Nigeria,na base on wetin go male them share money within themselves. Imagine the high rate of poverty for the country,our new president come enter finish. The first thing na to stop fuel subsidy in order for them to share subsidy money instead of them to focus on tackling the issue of the removal of the fuel subsidy. Na money them won share,forgetting say this action go inflate more hardship on the citizen and worry the country economy. Sometimes,I dey wonder whether all these leaders no suffer when them small and no decide to help people wey dey suffer for their agenda. Na only God fit help our country. Why e be say any new government wet enter na fuel subsidy he dey use worry the masses.But the main issue be say this suspension of fuel subsidy no suppose affect this fuel price like this but na because no proper price control body wey dey the country to stop this nonsense wey we Nigerians dey do to ourself. Just imagine now say you buy something your goods  for 1k and then you come dey sell for 1.5k then suddenly dey come remove subsidy  and you come increase the price to 4k where as you never even go market buy anoda stock oo but you don already add price for the thing, now  E GOOD LIKE THAT?

comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoHeadlineNews on June 23, 2023, 05:09:46 AMQuote from: Gozie51 on June 22, 2023, 04:41:40 PMThe politicians are insensitive to the feeling of the people, poverty dey everywhere but dem no want know about that one but instead dem go try carry more money enter house. Now we dey hear say dem want share the subsidy money wey comot whether na rumour we never know, inside every rumour small truth go dey inside. Them no even talk about refinery but na how to share money dem get interest even NLC self no dey help matter.Na better statement you just talk my brother man, because truly what I expected after the removal of this fuel subsidy matter na for Federal government to start to talk about reviving our old abandoned refineries back to start functioning again, so that we could no more keep buying fuel anymore. Because of what benefits will it be if the money is distributed,  of which I'm sure how the Covid-19 palliative ended up in the warehouses of top politicians, which I'm sure that's likewise how this money go be if shared. Because instead of sharing, they should use the money to create companies that will employ the youth.No be lie my brother, the matter tire person no be small. When president Goodluck Jonathan been remove the subsidy, na same people enter street go say dem do do occupy Nigeria and even then we see paliatives wey him bring then in buses wey try to reduce transportation cost, even then fuel na #145 but wetin we see today na #550 / #600 yet no palliative anywhere. When dem even talk about sharing money, the thing dey funny and shameful, how? Like say dem fit let money reach everyone abi na dem go still carry am enter house like dem do for COVID-19. I go dey wonder say dem no fit use BVN send money enter people account. Nigeria na the more you look the less you see.

comments.author: sokani
comments.created_time: June 29, 2023, 03:23:48 PMLast edit: June 29, 2023, 03:53:45 PM by sokani
comments.body: Marketers project N700/litre petrolQuoteThe Executive Secretary, Depot and Petroleum Products Marketers Association of Nigeria, Olufemi Adewole, told The PUNCH on Tuesday that the NMDPRA was currently licensing more importers. He said arrangements were on full speed for fresh products from July, adding that prices of products would depend on market fundamentalsQuoteA former chairman of the Major Oil Marketers Association of Nigeria, and Chief Executive Officer/Chairman of 11 Plc, Tunji Oyebanji, during a chat on Monday, said consumers should expect new pump prices close to that of diesel, and those of neigbouring African countries that also import petrol. Checks by The PUNCH showed that as of June 19, the price of one litre of petrol in Ghana, Cameroun, Benin was already above N800 per litre. Petrol currently sells for around N495 and above in Nigeria, with diesel price approaching N800 per litre.https://www.google.com/amp/s/punchng.com/marketers-project-n700-litre-petrol/%3fampThis one na one of the trending news today wey de for media and e concern de fuel mata and na im I say make I bring am here. De N520 wey we dey buy fuel already, we kno as e be for our body but if dis projections are correct, e go triple the suffering. According de National Controller Operations, Independent Petroleum Marketers Association of Nigeria, Mike Osatuyi, him project say dem fit sell fuel at N700 for de northern part of de country, N600 for Lagos and N600+ for outside Lagos, dis one na after dem don consider other factors like de exchange rate, crude oil price for international market and landing cost. How una see dis projections? Abi this one na friendly reminder for us to brace ourselves for de worst to come?

comments.author: GiftedMAN
comments.body: Quote from: sokani on June 29, 2023, 03:23:48 PMMarketers project N700/litre petrolQuoteThe Executive Secretary, Depot and Petroleum Products Marketers Association of Nigeria, Olufemi Adewole, told The PUNCH on Tuesday that the NMDPRA was currently licensing more importers. He said arrangements were on full speed for fresh products from July, adding that prices of products would depend on market fundamentalsQuoteA former chairman of the Major Oil Marketers Association of Nigeria, and Chief Executive Officer/Chairman of 11 Plc, Tunji Oyebanji, during a chat on Monday, said consumers should expect new pump prices close to that of diesel, and those of neigbouring African countries that also import petrol. Checks by The PUNCH showed that as of June 19, the price of one litre of petrol in Ghana, Cameroun, Benin was already above N800 per litre. Petrol currently sells for around N495 and above in Nigeria, with diesel price approaching N800 per litre.https://www.google.com/amp/s/punchng.com/marketers-project-n700-litre-petrol/%3fampThis one na one of the trending news today wey de for media and e concern de fuel mata and na im I say make I bring am here. De N520 wey we dey buy fuel already, we kno as e be for our body but if dis projections are correct, e go triple the suffering. According de National Controller Operations, Independent Petroleum Marketers Association of Nigeria, Mike Osatuyi, him project say dem fit sell fuel at N700 for de northern part of de country, N600 for Lagos and N600+ for outside Lagos, dis one na after dem don consider other factors like de exchange rate, crude oil price for international market and landing cost. How una see dis projections? Abi this one na friendly reminder for us to brace ourselves for de worst to come?Omor this one strong, as I read about the new price increase today I no fit vex again because nothing we never see for we country naija. How fuel wey just fly enter N511 as Baba just enter office take they go N700 when workers minimum wage never even increase how they wam make we survive? I think say the essence of the subsidy removal na to better our country but as ecbe nah, na so so suffering I dey see I never see wetin our president wam do to better the economy of Naija so make we just ready because from N700 na 1k we go enter direct for one litre.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on June 21, 2023, 06:05:26 PM one thing I love about most Nigerians is that regardless of how difficult it is to survive in this country people always device means to survive. This is both our blessing and our curse.Quote from: sokani on June 29, 2023, 03:23:48 PMMarketers project N700/litre petrolN700/litre will soon become the normal price, and we will be heading to N1000/litre maybe before this administration is over. I just dey pity all those businesses wey dey depend on petrol and diesel powered generators to run their business, because they will really be running at loss and those that cannot adjust will be forced to close up.
